Bookmarks

Ways to discover the Internet

  • https://blogroll.org/
  • https://webring.xxiivv.com/
  • https://theforest.link/
  • https://gossipsweb.net/

Internet pals

  • Simone Silvestroni: an Italian developer-musician whom I met on Mastodon. I love the way he engages with people on the Internet: curious, helpful, and honest. His website uses brutalist design principles. It’s one of my favorite personal sites.
  • Patrick Rhone: I learned of Patricks in the early 10s as one of thought leaders in the Internet’s minimalism trend. I was fortunate enough to finally meet him in 2023 when he visited Amsterdam with his family. He has a great sense of humor, and a wonderful, inclusive approach to being a human.
  • Elliott Cost: I met Elliott in 2022 because I saw on his website that he was in Amsterdam. We met at Simon Meijssen and talked about a documentary project he was working on. I absolutely adore his philosophy on personal websites. Every time I visit his, I see something entirely different. It’s the only personal site I know besides mine that has that feature.
  • John Boy: I know John because he asked me to give a guest lecture on ethnographic research in an industry context. Since then, we’ve come to start a tiny, unofficial IndieWeb Homebrew club.
  • Barry Frost: I know Barry only very vaguely, because we sometimes talk to each other via Webmention. I love the thoughtfulness of his website, and the way it truly feels like his digital living room.
  • Chris Wiegman:
  • Ru Singh:
  • Rachel Kwon
